feed.title: SLAUGHTER FILM
feed.subtitle:
The weekly podcast dedicated to reviewing the films that are legendary, even in HELL!
Horror, Sci-fi, Exploitation, Grindhouse, Indie Films and Documentaries.

entry.title: PODCAST 135: House On Haunted Hill & Tusk
entry.content:
This week Forest reviews House On Haunted Hill, visiting a time when William Castle got asses to fill seats in theaters showing his films by carrying out cheap and sometimes wild stunts. Cory discovers what a walrus man looks like with Kevin Smith's body horror monster movie Tusk.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 135: House On Haunted Hill & Tusk

entry.title: PODCAST SPECIAL: Top 5 Films of 2014
entry.content:
In this very special edition of Slaughter Film, Forest and Cory each review their favorite 5 films of 2014. Most of them aren't horror, and there may have been a few others worthy of being listed, but of the films Forest and Cory did see, these are their favorite of 2014.
CONTINUE READING

entry.title: PODCAST 134: Megan Is Missing & Snow Shark [DIY Edition]
entry.content:
This week Forest & Cory tackle a pair of films that leave them longing to watch another movie. Any other movie, just not the ones they watched. Forest rages about Megan Is Missing and Cory discussed Snow Shark, a movie about a shark in the snow.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 134: Megan Is Missing & Snow Shark [DIY Edition]

entry.title: PODCAST 133: Lady Terminator & Stigmata [Afflicted FemaleEdition]
entry.content:
This week the horror-duo kick off 2015 demands for hover boards! Forest takes on the high octane and low rent Lady Terminator about a killer sea wench. Cory sticks to the millennial faith based film Stigmata.
CONTINUE READING

entry.title: PODCAST 132: Terror Train & End of Days [New Year's Eve Edition]
entry.content:
This week the Horror Duo celebrate the coming of the new year. Out with the old and in with 2015. Forest shares his thoughts on Terror Train, an early slasher that takes place on New Year's Eve. And Cory covers the apocalyptic End of Days, also taking place on New Year's Eve.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 132: Terror Train & End of Days [New Year's Eve Edition]

entry.title: BAT REVIEW: Batman & Robin
entry.content:
Welcome to the fifth and final installment in the evolution of Batman in cinema series. All good things must come to an end, and to exemplify this we will be going out with a whimper, with Batman & Robin. Don't brush off this edition as us pointing out the foibles of a stinker. The conversation turns to philosophy and
CONTINUE READING

entry.title: PODCAST 131: Pulgasari & Black Christmas [Christmas Eve Edition]
entry.content:
This week Cory keeps things festive with Black Christmas, while Forest challenges Kim Jong Un with his politically charged rant about North Korea and the late, great, Kim Jon Il's Godzilla sized monster movie, Pulgasari.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 131: Pulgasari & Black Christmas [Christmas Eve Edition]

entry.title: PODCAT 130: The Babadook & Silent Night Deadly Night 3
entry.content:
This week Cory kicks off the Holiday festivities with the third installment of the '80s "Santa Killer" films, Silent Night, Deadly Night 3: Better Watch Out. Forest covers a new film, The Babadook.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAT 130: The Babadook & Silent Night Deadly Night 3

entry.title: PODCAST 129: Event Horizon & Day of the Dead 2: Contagium
entry.content:
After seeing Interstellar, Forest is on a bit of a space kick, as he re-visits "Hellraiser in space" with Event Horizon. Cory picks a flick out of the blue and is less that impressed with Day of the Dead 2: Contagium.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 129: Event Horizon & Day of the Dead 2: Contagium

entry.title: PODCAST 128: Videodrome & Chopping Mall
entry.content:
This week Cory celebrates the Black Friday festivities by reviewing a film with young adults being murdered in a mall, Chopping Mall. Forest kisses his t.v. job goodbye while reviewing Videodrome.
CONTINUE READING

entry.title: PODCAST 127: The Langoliers & Maximum Overdrive [The King is Dead Edition]
entry.content:
King Month comes to a close as Forest & Cory discuss a pair of lesser King adaptations. Forest takes on the made for television The Langoliers, about lack luster time eaters and Cory revisits Maximum Overdrive.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 127: The Langoliers & Maximum Overdrive [The King is Dead Edition]

entry.title: BAT REVIEW: Batman Forever
entry.content:
Welcome to part four of our five part mini series covering the evolution of Batman in cinema. Forest & Cory will be sharing their love for Batman while celebrating the 75th Anniversary of Batman. The time has now come to focus on the Joel Schumacher era.
CONTINUE READING

entry.title: PODCAST 126: Cujo & The Town That Dreaded Sundown [The King Has Left the Building Edition]
entry.content:
As another week passes, another Stephen King adaptation shall be reviewed. This time around Forest shares his thought on Cujo. Cory detours from King material to cover the remake/sequel, The Town That Dreaded Sundown.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 126: Cujo & The Town That Dreaded Sundown [The King Has Left the Building Edition]

entry.title: PODCAST 125: Ouija & Thinner [The Bachman Affair]
entry.content:
Stephen King Month continues as Cory takes a look at Thinner. An adaptation of a King story from his "Bachman Years". Forest escapes King long enough to share his thoughts on another board game movie, Ouija.
CONTINUE READING

entry.title: PODCAST 124: The Dead Zone & The Night Flier [Long Live the King Edition]
entry.content:
This week Forest & Cory pack their bags and head to the state of Maine to celebrate the legendary career of Stephen King, the master of horror. This week Forest receives permissions from The Dead Zone and Cory gets visited by The Night Flier, a film that
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 124: The Dead Zone & The Night Flier [Long Live the King Edition]

entry.title: PODCAST 123: Halloween 6: The Curse of Michael Myers
entry.content:
This week Forest & Cory celebrate Halloween a few days early by continuing their review of the Halloween franchise. This time Halloween 6: The Curse of Michael Myers is on the chopping block.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 123: Halloween 6: The Curse of Michael Myers

entry.title: BAT REVIEWS: Batman Returns
entry.content:
Welcome to the third in a five part mini series. Forest & Cory will be sharing their love for Batman in cinema. Celebrate the 75th Anniversary of Batman, this series will chronicle the evolution of Batman, starting with the original movie from 1966, and continuing through the
CONTINUE READING

entry.title: PODCAST 122: Man's Best Friend & Project: Metalbeast [Leg Humper Edition]
entry.content:
This week Forest & Cory travel thru time to share their thoughts on a pair of K9 related films. Forest reviews Man's Best Friend featuring Lance Henrikson. Cory takes things in the direction of dumb with Project: Metalbeast.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 122: Man's Best Friend & Project: Metalbeast [Leg Humper Edition]

entry.title: PODCAST SPECIAL: Eerie Horror Film Festival & Expo 2014 [Day Three]
entry.content:
Well, all good things must come to an end. Another EHFF is now behind us. Thankfully the Horror Duo have have yet to succumb to madness. However, they may now have slightly less control of their bowels, but that's a personal problem and you should mind your business. Day
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST SPECIAL: Eerie Horror Film Festival & Expo 2014 [Day Three]

category.term: The Many Lives of Jovan Cornejo

entry.title: PODCAST SPECIAL: Eerie Horror Film Festival & Expo 2014 [Day Two]
entry.content:
Success! Forest and Cory have survived the monsters, killers and ghosts of day one and are back to share with you even more EHFF fun. Some of our favorite films were shows on day two, including The Many Lives of Jovan Cornejo, Ruby's Skin, Bloody Knuckles
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST SPECIAL: Eerie Horror Film Festival & Expo 2014 [Day Two]

entry.title: PODCAST SPECIAL: Eerie Horror Film Festival & Expo 2014 [Day One]
entry.content:
It has begun! Forest and Cory have again locked themselves into the historic Warner theater for three days of terror! The horror-duo, accompanied by some of their best-est friends and alcohol, will be recapping the days events -- sharing their thoughts on some of the best of the fest.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST SPECIAL: Eerie Horror Film Festival & Expo 2014 [Day One]

entry.title: PODCAST 121: Tales From the Quadead Zone & Septic Man [Shit Edition]
entry.content:
Forest concludes his trek into the films of VHS rental past with a rather rare one, Tales From the Quadead Zone. Cory follows with yet another recent indie release, this time about a poop filled sewer, Septic Man.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 121: Tales From the Quadead Zone & Septic Man [Shit Edition]

entry.title: PODCAST 120: Voyage of the Rock Aliens & Almost Human [Aliens Among Us Edition]
entry.content:
This week Forest reviews another film relegated to the VHS archives and the memories of rental past. That film is Voyage of the Rock Aliens. Cory, also reviewing a film featuring aliens and space, Almost Human.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 120: Voyage of the Rock Aliens & Almost Human [Aliens Among Us Edition]

entry.title: PODCAST 119: Clearcut & Willow Creek [Grizzled In The Woods Edition]
entry.content:
This week Forest reviews Clearcut. Another VHS rarity of rental past about a grizzled Native American. Cory shares his thoughts on Bobcat Goldthwait's newest film Willow Creek. A film about grizzled towns folk and the hunt for Sasquatch.
CONTINUE READING

link.title: PODCAST 119: Clearcut & Willow Creek [Grizzled In The Woods Edition]

entry.content:
